definition: an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this
Qing or Ch'ing dynasty of imperial China (1644-1911)/surname Qing
clear/distinct/quiet/just and honest/pure/to settle or clear up/to clean up or purge
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

sentences.english: People say "the outsider see the best of the game. " Will you please make a comment on the fair?
sentences.chinese: 人们都说“旁观者清”，请您对交易会作个评价好吗？

sentences.english: Is it doubtful that the onlooker sees most of the game ?
sentences.chinese: 旁观者清，这一点还有什么可疑的吗？

definition: an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

definition: clear as a flame (idiom); to see things absolutely clearly
the person involved/the people holding power
lit. eyes obscured by a single leaf (idiom)/fig. not seeing the wider picture/can't see the wood for the trees
spectator/non-participant
outside (a group etc)/not connected (with an event etc)/external
one's own wishful thinking
overtones in conversation/things indirectly implied from what is said
loyal advice jars on the ears (idiom)
to straighten out/to explain/to ease sb's anxiety
to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
hard to fathom a person's mind (idiom)
know yourself, know your enemy (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
one word says it all (idiom)/to hit the nail on the head/to be pithy and correct
even an honest and upright official will have difficulty resolving a family dispute (proverb)
pinyin: qing1 guan1 nan2 duan4 jia1 wu4 shi4
